review:
Plazma Being was not a game I liked playing. The controls are so terrible that it drove me mad. I made a significant effort to learn this game, its physics, and I had thought that with practice, I would become more adept at using the controls, but that didn't happen at all. The only challenge in this game is controlling the character because the solutions to the numerous riddles are usually really obvious.
It is quite hard to complete a series of chores quickly since the character responds to input very slowly.

You cannot see the mouse pointer when in "building mode". This means that, due to the poor controls, you will almost certainly repeat tasks such as quickly grabbing an obstacle to change the direction of the read beam or quickly jumping over obstacles. You will also continuously struggle to locate the mouse pointer, which only appears briefly after switching modes.
Moreover, the game has a lot of bugs; I frequently got stuck beneath and even inside something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1627891477}
review:
Plazma Being is a 2D retro puzzle platformer made with Unity.  Control a blob of "energy" and roll around solving various puzzles.

This isn't the worst platformer I've seen on Steam and despite being made with Unity, it's not an asset flip.  It seems like a lot of work and genuine purpose went into making a 2D retro platformer in 2015, some 20 years after the S3 Virge and ATI Rage ushered in 3D graphics and made 2D games like this obsolete.   As far as platformers go, it's slow and tedious.  Sure, not every platformer needs to be like as twitchy as Super Meatboy, but there should be some kind of action going on sometimes.  I fell asleep trying to roll from one side of the screen to the other.

review:
Описание:
Plazma Being – пазл-платформер от независимых разработчиков, в котором вы сыграете за необычное существо по имени Зеб. Это небольшой сгусток энергии на основе формы жизни из космоса, известной как Plazma Being.
Во время своего космического путешествия нашего героя похищают пришельцы и бесцеремонно бросают в плен на своей планете. Но Зебу повезло. Череда прошедших землетрясений сильно потрепала планету неприятеля и практически уничтожила всех инопланетян, дав тем самым герою шанс на спасение. Теперь вам вместе с Зебом предстоит преодолеть непростой путь по разрушенной планете в поисках космического корабля, который позволит ему вернуться обратно домой.
В Plazma Being вас ждет 10 уровней, разбросанных в 3 различных локациях.

Моя оценка: 10/10

review:
Достаточно интересная и необычная игра со множеством разнообразных головоломок, в которой игроку предоставляется возможность играть от лица некоего плазменного создания, волею случая попавшего в чужеродный враждебный мир и пытающегося из него выбраться и спастись. По мере прохождения уровней и сбора специальной энергии, возможности нашего плазменного создания существенным образом возрастают, но при этом и усложняются встречающиеся на пути препятствия и головоломки...
Plazma Being — приятная игра с симпатичной графикой и неплохим звуковым сопровождением, не требовательная к ресурсам компьютера. Пожалуй, играть в неё очень долго и регулярно кому-либо вряд ли захочется, но запускать периодически, чтобы немного размять и потренировать свои извилины — вполне вероятно...

review:
[h1]Plazma Being[/h1]
Jest to gra logiczna w której to wcielamy się w plazmę imieniem Zeb i staramy się wrócić do kosmosu z którego porwali nas kosmici. Na początku wszystko wydaje się proste i przyjemne, (np. używając umiejętności manipulacji obiektami ułóż dwie skrzynki jedna na drugiej wskocz na nie i przeskocz na następną platformę) jednak z każdym kolejnym poziomem wzrasta również trudność. Pod koniec przygody zaczyna się prawdziwy parkour. ;) Aby ukończyć grę musimy przejść 10 poziomów, pokonując w między czasie trzy bossy (na każdego trzeba znaleźć sposób). Tło naszej wędrówki zmienia się co parę poziomów więc nie jest aż tak monotonnie. Podczas gry towarzyszy nam muzyczka której głośność możemy sobie dostosować w ustawieniach, możemy również wybrać tam rozdzielczość w jakiej czujemy się najlepiej. Ogólnie gra jest dobra dla osób lubiących łamigłówki, posiada karty kolekcjonerskie steam, osiągnięcia i na promocji jest możliwa do kupienia za około 2-3zł Podsumowując:
Plusy
+ została tu przedstawiona jakaś historia
+ karty kolekcjonerskie steam
+ działające osiągnięcia 
+ umiarkowany poziom trudności
+ więcej niż jeden boss do pokonania
+ na promocji się opłaca ;)
Minusy
- ale bez promocji już nie za bardzo ;p
- nie ma możliwości odpalenia gry na full screenie
- czasami nie wiadomo co trzeba zrobić w określonej sytuacji

review:
I did not enjoy playing Plazma Being. I got to halfway the final level (10) and finally gave up on the game because the controls are just too awful. I really put in some serious effort to get to grips with this game and I had hoped that with practice I would get a better hang of the controls - but that didn't happen at all. The solutions to the various puzzles are usually plain to see, but the sole difficulty of this game is in controlling the character.
The character is very slow to respond to input, making it unduly difficult to perform a string of tasks in rapid succession. When in default mode (for lack of a better word for it) you do not see the mouse pointer, so when you have to switch to another mode, for instance when you need to quickly grab a beam with your red ray (grapling hook?) while suspended in mid air, you are constantly struggling to quickly locate your mouse pointer which only appears shortly after you switched modes.
Furthermore, the game is quite buggy - I often got stuck under and even inside steam beams.

review:
외계 생명체에 의해 납치된 Zeb, 그가 우주공간으로 돌아가기 위한 탈출을 다룬 플랫폼 게임인 [b]《플라즈마 존재》[/b]다. 캐릭터를 중심으로 발산 가능한 플라즈마의 범위가 있고, 그 범위 내에서 염력이나 기타 기술들을 활용하여 주어진 난관을 극복해나가는 게임방식을 가지고 있다. 트레일러만 보면 솔직히 재미는 1도 없을 것처럼 보이는데, 막상 해보면 그리 나쁘진 않은 게임.

 + 짧은 플레이 타임(총 10레벨)
 + 전반적으로 쉬운 난이도(단 조작에 조금 익숙해질 필요가 있음)
 + 잔잔하게 듣기 좋은 BGM
 + 영상으로 된 가이드가 존재함
 + 도전과제 올클리어가 참 정말 대단히 쉽다
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(플탐 대비 파밍시간 많이 긴 편)

 - 재시작 핫키가 존재하지 않아서 약간 불편함
 - 마우스로 물체 밀고 끌 때, 지 멋대로 튕겨나가는 현상(이거 좀 빡침)

짧게 치고 빠지기 좋은 게임. 플레이 타임에 비해 정가는 너무 과한 편이니, 관심 있는 사람은 되도록 할인 기간 때 구매하도록 하자.

review: There may be the seed of a good game somewhere in here, but the version that exists at present is too poorly developed to be any fun. Like [I]Closure[/i] or [i]Inside[/i], this is a trial-and-error game with lots of dying and respawning, but here the checkpoints are too far apart, and respawning involves an agonizing wait through an unecessary fade-to-black. To make matters worse, it's incredibly easy to lose necessary movable blocks down pits, and lost blocks do not return on their own, even to their orignial spawn point (à la [i]Portal[/i]). Over half of my (very tedious) deaths were suicides made simply to reset the level, and I resented every wasted second.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072364941', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1505145167}
review:
First of all, I would like to say I got this game for 50 eurocents via a coupon of a friend. I saw this game had achievements and even trading cards, so I mainly hoped for something decent or maybe even good. I didn't find what I was hoping for.

Plazma Being is a puzzle platformer in which you control a flame thing from space that can change forms. That about sums up the whole depth of this game. I was REALLY hoping I would find more depth, but as I continued to level 10 and beat the game (yes the game is that short), I barely got any. The only depth you will find in this game is beginning with 2 forms and ending with 4(!) forms to change between as you progress through the game, 3 very lackluster bosses, which required only a slight bit of thinking and generally 1 ability (with a bit of luck) and some sort of collectibles in the form of energy bubbles which enable you to progress, depending on if you play on the teleporter charger mode (if I say this right). If you play on the other mode (on which I fully forgot the name, sorry!) you don't need to collect the energy bubbles.

Now I can almost hear you thinking; 'Well what did you expect for 2 euro's (or in your case 50 eurocents)?' To be honest, I didn't expect a really unique indie game or anything like that, but I did expect a fun platformer to have a couple of hours of fun. Well, it would be fun if the above written (part about the depth of the game) was all I had to nag about. Instead I got steadily more frustrated as I played on. I am not gonna list every negative point, as my hands already hurt from playing this game with the controls it gave to me.

Pro's


- Cheap, especially with coupon(s).

- Easy to understand, although the game doesn't have a tutorial, it's clear in every level what you are supossed to do and even if you missed energy bulbs (which the game also makes clear at some point during the game).

- Clear indicator when placing/freezing blocks midair, so that you can see when you can jump onto the block or not.

- Your character sometimes make some slightly cute noise.

Con's


- Buggy. Sometimes you can't jump for some reason, sometimes you can't go under blocks you placed/freezed midair for no reason (unless your hitbox suddenly grows at that exact point *cough*), sometimes blocks shoot away when you are trying to displace them with your powerups, and so on. First this isn't that bad as you can reset via a nearby checkpoint, but it happened so many times (at the very least 2 times per level with me) it really ruins the game.

- The controls. I picked up my xbox controller when booting up the game, didn't work. Ok, then with keyboard. A and D to move, W to jump, L to restart (from a checkpoint) and mouse for your powerups (scrolling alternates between powerups and clicking left or right mouse button uses them). The main character controls like a piece of rock tied to a persons leg. Very sluggish, but once you get moving stopping is a bit... wonky...

- The bosses, which I mentioned earlier. Obvious spoiler alert: the bosses are very simple and require a slight bit of skill. Fighting the bosses consist of doing one action, sometimes multiple times. Reflecting a laser, bouncing a bomb back and sitting on top of the boss describe all the 3 bosses and how to beat them in one sentence.

- The game mechanics and "puzzles". When trying to use your powers to displace objects with your mouse in this game, you get a clear circle of the extend to which you can displace objects. Problem is, when you move objects, the circle gets smaller the faster you move them to prevent you from throwing objects farther away then you should be able to. If you try to move an object just a little bit to the sides of your circle, good luck, because your object will fall into a void (which means restarting!~). There are some more minor issues with mechanics, but I will leave it for you (the reader) to discover. The puzzles however, are godawful sometimes. The puzzles that require you to think are sometimes challenging, but other times just downright annoying. Luckily you can skip entire puzzles whilst asking yourself; '...Was I supossed to do that...?'. Eventually I got stuck at one puzzle, looked it up on youtube and the guy who "solved" the puzzle literally said the same thing I thought; 'Was that the solution or did I do this wrong?'.

- Lastly, the feel of this game. I simply feel the developer just lost interest halfway through the game and finished it in a hurry, which explain the bugs and the ways you can cheat yourself through puzzles.

I wouldn't even mind if this game was released in an even slightly worse state, but it just almost sickens me that the developer even asked money for this, when it doesn't even feel full effort (again, MAINLY in terms of bugs and puzzles) was put into this game. I can search on kongregate for more fun platformers which will entertain me more and longer for free, which also give me the feeling more effort was put into it.

TL:DR
You would be better of playing a fun platformer on kongregate for free, I really think the developer of this game shouldn't have even asked for money for this game.

review:
[h1] アクションとパズルの要素が絶妙なアクションパズル  [/h1]

アクションパズル好きなら、セール時お値段以上ニトリよりお買い得です。

[h1] ゲーム内容 [/h1]

火の玉みたいなキャラを操作して全ステージ１０をクリアしていくアクションパズルで、メタモルフォーゼすることで遠隔操作で物を動かしたり固定したりだの、物に乗り移ったり、ターザンよろしくの物でぶらぶらしたりできます、それらを駆使してクリアを目指しましょう、最初は遠隔操作のみである程度ステージを進めていくと新たな能力を身につけていきます。

基本的に敵はいませんが数ステージ毎にボスが居ます、なかなかの緊張感を味わえるでしょう。

[h1] 個人的に思った事や感想 [/h1]

自分がやってるゲームをよく貶すフレンドが、何故かいきなりブラックジャックの劇場版を新しくやってほしいと話しかけてきた、取りあえず私もブラックジャックは好きなのでどのお話を劇場版にしてほしいと聞いたら、オリジナルでやってほしいとの事しかしその直後にオリジナルでやっても糞そうだよなと言って一方的にオフラインになった。

うーん、てめぇええええええええの頭をブラックジャック先生に見てもらったらいいんじゃないですかねぇくそがｗ

[h1] Если бы я так считал, я бы сказал что этот платформер слишком готичный (но в этом мнении виноваты текстуры, которые как я понял, черезчур "тёмные"). 	[/h1]

Игра. Ну. Платформер. Сюжет не особо важен, ибо его тут почти и нет - выбраться с планеты.

Мы играем за светящийся шарик, наша задача пройти из точки А в точку В попутно справляясь с задачками встречаемыми по пути. основная особенность нашего персонажа (да и всей игры в целом) - это смена режимов игры колёсиком мыши (что очень не удобно), в синем режиме наш шарик не может двигаться, но за то может поднимать ящики и другие предметы, а после их фиксировать в воздухе (причем, фиксировать навсегда, и уже если запорите уровень придёться начинать с чекпоинта), а в обычном (жёлтом) режиме мы можем двигаться по этим предметам для продвижения к финалу.

Сложный. 6 из 10. (Причина -4 баллов: Кривое управление+Тупое построение уровней). В целом, поиграть можно, 30 минут...

review:
Plazma Being – пазл-платформер от независимых разработчиков, в котором вы сыграете за необычное существо по имени Зеб. Это небольшой сгусток энергии на основе формы жизни из космоса, известной как Plazma Being.
Во время своего космического путешествия нашего героя похищают пришельцы и бесцеремонно бросают в плен на своей планете. Но Зебу повезло. Череда прошедших землетрясений сильно потрепала планету неприятеля и практически уничтожила всех инопланетян, дав тем самым герою шанс на спасение. Теперь вам вместе с Зебом предстоит преодолеть непростой путь по разрушенной планете в поисках космического корабля, который позволит ему вернуться обратно домой.
В Plazma Being вас ждет 10 уровней, разбросанных в 3 различных локациях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083845098', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1492666363}
review:
[b]Plazma Being[/b] - типичный инди-платформер с элементами головоломки. Однако видно что сделан он с душой. Несомненным плюсом является наличие хоть и очень простенького, но сюжета. Игра в меру короткая (всего 10 уровней), однако каждый из них запоминается и имеет свою изюминку. Автор реализовал интересную механику - наш персонаж имеет 3 формы которыми мы будем пользоваться чтобы пройти дальше по уровню. Мы можем вселяться в предметы (будь-то ящики или шестерёнки), перетаскивать их при помощи верёвки, цепляться за препятствия и в стиле Индианы Джонса перепрыгивать таким образом значительное расстояние. Соответственно для каждого умения нужно менять свою оболочку, точнее цвет. 
[h1] tl;dr [/h1]
В целом, получилось очень неплохо.  Если у вас игра завалялась после раздачи в библиотеке (как у меня), то непременно сыграйте. Вам понравится.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178240402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1710879339}
review:
Kurzweiliges 2-D-Jump 'n' Run mit teilweise kniffligen Rätseln, welche aber alle im Grunde genommen leicht zu lösen sind.
Es macht mehr Spaß, wenn man nicht versucht es am Stück durchzuspielen.

Das Spiel hat ein paar kleinere Bugs. Manche Objekte werden bei einem Level-Neustart falsch oder an einem Ort respawnt, wo man sie nicht mehr wegbekommt. Aber das stört nicht wirklich, da man beliebig oft neu laden kann und nach kurzer Zeit hat man das Objekt auch wieder frei bekommen.
Außerdem bekomme ich partout eine Errungenschaft nicht, obwohl ich die Bedingungen erfüllt habe.

Bei kniffligen (jeder empfindet diese anders ;) ) Problemen, bei denen man partout nicht auf die Lösung kommt,  hilft es sehr in die Komplett-Lösung zu schauen.^^ Bei den meisten Rätseln braucht man so oder so mehrere Anläufe.

Die meisten Speicherpunkte sind gut gesetzt, manche nicht so sehr, aber das erhöht bloß die Spannung.

Alles in allem gut spielbar. Es ist insgesamt recht kurzweilig. Ich habe es in knapp 4 h durchgespielt.

Ob man 1,99 € dafür ausgeben sollte? Das muss jeder für sich entscheiden. Allerdings gibt es ja noch Sales und Bundles, wodurch man das Spiel schon für wenige Cent bekommen kann. Potenziell auch kostenlos, natürlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989273094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1491581240}
review:
Plazma Being has an enjoyable, albeit simple, storyline and some innovative platform/puzzle mechanics. There are multiple character modes which allow you different options to interact with the environment. These modes, when they are initially found, will trigger small tutorial pop-ups, followed by a simple puzzle that requires the use of the new ability. This is an excellent feature and greatly assists with the learning curve of the game.

The music/sound effects are simple and generally relaxing. 
Graphics are simple and highly suitable to a platform game.

Controls are typical WASD for movement with the scroll wheel of the mouse being the default to cycle through the character modes/types. Overally they are generally responsive, however, I have found there does seem to be some delay in jumping which can result in one "skidding off" the edge of a given platform.

The implemented physics are above average for games of this type and generally make logical sense. However, velocity of blocks et al. can be unexpectedly fast at times--with what one would consider a minor movement resulting in a block flying off the screen.

There are two tiers of saves. A general save slot which stores one's overall progress and waypoints within given levels. As the puzzles are very specific (although there is generally more than one solution--intentioned or not given the physics in the game) you will find yourself reloading to waypoints akin to Groundhog Day. This can, as with any waypoint system, become very tedious, with otherwise simple puzzles becomming more of a chore depending on finesse level. The waypoints are, however, common enough, as to generally make any reattempts quick.

I have enjoyed Plazma Being as a relaxed platform/puzzle game and originally purchased this when discounted. I have, enjoyed the game enough that when the opportunity presented to get a free key I responded to the forum post for such and have since given out two copies(I was given 2 keys not just one) of Plazma being to other individuals.

The game can be frustrating in that Groundhog Day/Edge of Tomorrow sort of way. However, taken in small bites, it is a very well designed platformer and well worth it's price point (which is very often discounted by coupons or general sales).

review:
The game has a good story, but it is simply unpolsihed in the logic puzzles. the physics of some objects make it extremely difficult to get around and the puzzles sometimes will get you stuck in such a way that you have to restart the game to redo that section of the puzzle.

The physics are VERY awkward and some objects actualy defy physics by stopping pre-maturely. For example, there is a swing puzzle in the game but they will not swing further than the "stopping" point they have designed in them unless you use the kenisis powers, and you fall off if you use kenisis while you are on them. second, the swings swing FASTER not FURTHER when you "Dance" on them throwing off timing for your jump.

By the time i got to the first part of the puzzle that forces you to restart the game to do it over I put the game down and decided i wouldnt play it anymore, the game is simply too unpolish to be enjoyable.

review:
刚好赶上打折，1元入的，本想当做喜+1的小游戏，玩着玩着莫名发现这游戏还有点难度，再加上本人是严重的全成就强迫患者，于是在打完了第4关解锁了一个成就后决定坚持不懈的玩下去，直到把成就收集全为止
目前打了3.1个小时，只玩到了第5关中间，听说后面会越来越恶心，莫名替手残的自己担心啊orz

游戏本身的操作没什么难度，但是要想想出过关的办法还需要动一点脑筋，这大概也是有人把它归为解谜类游戏的一个原因吧
音乐让人听着很舒服，在打boss的时候也会有相对紧张的音乐，跟情境的契合度很好

偶尔打打玩还是蛮不错的，推荐打折时入手


=========我是一条全成就分界线=========
5.8h之后，终于拿到了全成就，感觉自己这手残没救了【手动再见】
所有的成就都是跟着游戏流程走的，不会有多周目的要求，全成就党的福音！

review:
一款平台动作解谜游戏，以解谜为主，动作部分对手速有些许要求，但不至于卡关。游戏难度递进方面做的非常好，谜题设计也相当有水平，且基本没有冗余关卡。喜欢解谜游戏的玩家必入。

这是一个等离子生命体逃离可怕的星球的故事……算了，剧情是恶俗的，但是解谜游戏谁在乎剧情呢？

游戏一共十关，其中第4、7、10关有BOSS，击败BOSS能解锁新能力。初期的特殊能力是意念移物。第4关解锁震动与瞬移能力，谜题难度开始提升，直到第7关达到顶峰。第7关解锁荡秋千能力，解谜成分下降，动作成分提升，最后一关有个恶心的沙虫，对手速有一定要求（原来躺在床上玩，最后不得不起床到桌子上玩，MDZZ）[spoiler]我是说那沙虫，不是说我自己[/spoiler]

社区有全视频攻略，我被机械齿轮卡关，就是视频攻略拯救了我。

没啥好说的了，毕竟游戏很小，吐槽一下吧：
1. 剧情字幕太太太太太慢了，还不能跳过。我英文菜的抠脚都嫌慢，真不知道英语语系玩家是如何忍受的。
2. 鼠标移动到能力范围外后，道具会自动掉落，这不够人性。
3. 箱子移动到自己跳不到的高度时会变红，这本来是个很人性化的设定。问题是实际跳跃高度比箱子变红的高度要高一点，而有一个谜题就必须要把箱子摆到极限高度才行。这实在是太坑了。

review:
Возьмите под свой контроль Зеба в этом пазл-платформере. Он — малая частичка энергии, известная как Плазма Бытия. Во время прогулки возле своего дома, Зеб был похищен инопланетянами. Они взяли его на свою планету и бесцеремонно бросили в плен. В это же время серия землетрясений потрясло планету и посеяла хаос в инопланетной цивилизации, но зато дало Зебу шанс спастись.

Зеб отправится на поиски космического корабля, который даст ему возможность выбраться к своей любимой холодной пустоте космоса. Искать будет первым делом на поверхности планеты, где встретятся ему немало странных существ и роботов, ему придётся использовать свои энергетические способности, чтобы преодолевать препятствия.

review: Plazma Being é um jogo engraçado, muito produtivo pois requer capacidade de pensamento e contrução de ideias de forma a conseguir passar os níveis do jogo, uma vez que o grau de dificuldade aumenta conforme ultrapassamos de niveis; Para alem disso é necessario saber explorar o local e tentar arranjar soluções para conseguir energia e novas formas de passar os obstaculos, como por exemplo ajudando criaturas que vão aparecendo no jogo e que dificultam a nossa passagem. Todavia, acho que deveria ser incluido um toturial mais eficiente para aqueles que têm mais dificuldades de orientação e de resolução de problemas. Apesar de tudo, é um jogo criativo, com uma história que nos atrai ainda mais pois é algo com fundamento.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054182938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1484997833}
review:
Probably all of my friends know which types of games I don't really like. One of those categories that I generally don't enjoy playing is 2d platformers. I usually find them boring or simply not challenging enaugh and the graphics are poor. This game though ... it is sooo much different than most of the 2d platformers I've seen or played.

First off, it has a really intrigueing story-line (not those boring, old ones, like: "save the princess"). I found myself captivated by the story line and the scenery in which it is placed from the first few seconds I've opened the game. The developers were quite creative in creating such a beautifull story-line and that says a lot during times like these, in which any game that has a cute, half-naked, underaged anime girl can be a top-seller (Don't get me wrong, who doesn't like that? Hahahahah. But still, I hope you get my message).

Secondly, the puzzle-aspect of the game is challenging enaugh to keep me, a person who usually hates 2d platformers, focused on the task at hand.

Altough I enjoy most of the features this game has to offer, I also have to say that there are a few minor bugs (or issues) with the game, in my opinion. Most of those can be overlooked, but the one that kept affecting me the most was the following one: when I switched to blue form to grab an object, the object would move like my game was laggy or something like that (it would move in a laggy-sort-of way and would sometimes stop untill I moved my mouse cursor a bit closer to it, even though my mouse cursor would be in the range of my ability the whole time).

Also, I'm not a speedrunner or "game tester" myself, but I think some exploits are bound to be found if there are no FPS limits (I was literally able to get over 4000 FPS while playing and I think that could affect the game in a negative way).

Despite that, I really found the game enjoyable and entertaining. For only 2 euros, it is definately worth buying and playing.

Puzzles are good enough, though they are not surprising you when you solve them. They might be pretty easy to solve and it's fun trying to find a way to the solution. However the physics in this game are not so complex and it makes this game kind of dull when it comes together with the generic art syle. Also, it takes time to restart when you fail. I wish there was a faster and easier way to do it.

Overall, it's a solid game with a few flaws but definitely worth a playthrough if you enjoy platformers.

review:

I ran into an area after the first boss where I only had a lockable block and a teleport block to work with and could see no way forward with just that.  I managed to drag two pieces forward from the prevous puzzle to help stand on, but still couldn't get quite far enough forward.  Then on the next try one of those two pieces I was trying to stand on got knocked into they abyss.  I pressed L to restart from the last checkpoint, and the piece that had gotten lost was still gone.  So now I have to start over from the start of the level to drag the piece forward with me again?  Forget it.  I'm done.  Fun while it lasted I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051898442', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1464241696}
review:
プラットフォーム系でアクション要素ありのパズルゲーム。

なんか知らんけど宇宙をふらふらしてる主人公くんが、なんか知らんけどなんか知らんエイリアンに拉致監禁されて、なんか知らんけど地震で檻が壊れたからなんか知らんけどこれは逃げるしかないんじゃない？みたいな、全体的になんかよく知らん人たちがなんかよく知らん理由で行動する感じのストーリー。
いいんです。アクションパズルゲームなんでストーリーなんかいいんですべつに。

デフォだと黄色い主人公くん、青、紫、赤の3色に切り替わって、念力的なビロビロ光線でパズルをクリアしていきます。
青色は遠隔操作。ブロックなんかをマウスカーソルでもってぐいぐい動かして、右クリックでブロックを空中に固定しちゃったりします。
紫色はポゼッション的なあれです。特定のブロックに乗り移ることができます。
赤色は、なんていうんですか。スイング的なあれです。ワイヤーフックみたいに、なんていうんですか。ぶらーんぶらーんって。なんていうんですかね。なんかほら、ワイヤーフックみたいに。うん、そんな感じです。

正直言って、そこまで作り込まれたゲームでもなく、夢中になって遊ぶほどのあれでもなく、さっさっさーっと気軽にプレイして、たまに詰まって、でもそんなに詰まることもなくって、気づいたら終わってる感じの。そんな感じのやつな感じですかね。

操作感はそこまでよくないですけど、とくに悪くもなく、難易度もまったく高いとは言えないけど、それほど低すぎもしないし、うん。
全体的にこう、印象の薄いゲームですかね。
プラットフォームアクションパズルが好きで好きでしょうがない！ウワー！ みたいな人がいたら、ぜひ買ってみてください。
たぶんクリアして半年経たないうちにこのゲームの存在を忘れてると思いますので。

なんだか無味無臭なゲームでした。
とはいえ安いし(セールに入っていたらなお安いし)、ほんの気分転換くらいの気持ちで遊ぶにはじゅうぶんでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198013737716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1457692389}
review:
First of all, beware of the spoilers in the video and screenshots on the store page. I didn't watch the video until after I played the game, and I was amazed at how many solutions to puzzles that it contained. Now onto the review.

This game was a hidden gem for me. I was in the mood for a game that I could comfortably play in a weekend. I liked the idea and the look of the graphics of this, so I gave it a shot. I ended up enjoying this far more than I thought I would. It also took a bit longer to play than I was expecting, but that was mostly due to me getting stuck on a couple of puzzles. I got a great sense of satisfaction when I did figure out the solutions, and they always felt reasonable and logical. If I stopped playing and came back to it later with a fresh set of eyes, most of the solutions seemed obvious.

Generally the game is all about using your brain to solve puzzles, but there some parts that test your platforming skills. It had a good progression of adding abilities to keep the levels fresh. It was impressive how well the puzzles were made to use all the abilities, and even at one stage had a puzzle based on [spoiler]the sound made when selecting the different abilities[/spoiler]. Some people have complained about the short length of the game, but I don't think that adding any more levels would have resulted in any new type of puzzle. I was quite happy with the way the game ended.

[h1]Performance on low-end systems[/h1]
The game plays perfectly on my netbook powered by a 1GHz dual core AMD C-50 processor at 1024x600 (below the minimum spec). The minimum resolution is 800x600 (why don't system requirements ever state this) and it supports windowed mode. It also worked surprisingly well using a trackpad instead of a mouse, although I did my full play through on my desktop system so I only tested the trackpad on the first few levels.

I think yes, i've enjoyed this game, and the only con is graphics (not really my cons, as i prefer gameplay, not graphics :) ).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025135104', 'num_games_owned': 3459, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1469414389}
review:
Lee esta reseña desde mi blog: http://www.agustinfest.com/2015/09/plazma-being-resena/
O también, si lo prefieres, puedes verla en video: http://www.ociotakus.com/plazma-being-resena/

No tengo mucho qué decir acerca de Plazma Being. Jugué cuatro niveles de diez. Más de lo que esperaba. Fueron unas tres o cuatro horas. Sin embargo, esos cuatro niveles que jugué fueron suficientes para que el producto me diera curiosidad. Resulta que Plazma Being es el trabajo de un sólo hombre: Felix Wunderlich, un desarrollador de Irlanda. Lo conseguí en un bundle. Casi puedo decir que es un regalo. El problema es que no soy muy afecto a las plataformas cuando las combinan con acertijos (puzzles). Prefiero mis plataformas en un tenor un poco más dinámico, volátil, inesperado.

Los puntos débiles de Plazma Being: sus texturas, su diseño de personajes, sus sonidos y su música parecen fáciles, sacados de algún sitio de stock. Están bien escogidos pero queda esa leve duda.

Sin embargo, los puntos buenos son suficientes para provocar la inspiración: la jugabilidad es excelente. El desarrollador fue meticuloso para asegurarse de que manejar a Zeb, el monito de plasma, se convierta en un placer y con ello invita a una exploración gozosa, casi infantil, de los escenarios. Los niveles, a su vez, fueron diseñados con sumo cuidado para aumentar progresivamente la dificultad del juego. Cosa que no es fácil. Felix tiene colmillo. También el juego, en sus breves retazos escritos, despliega humor y elocuencia. Tiene más historia y más carcajadas que en juegazos comerciales.

Recomiendo este juego como un aliciente, un amuleto de inspiración. Este es el trabajo mínimo que puede alcanzar una sola persona (claro, también está Cave Story y Braid, pero… en algún lado se debe empezar. Plazma Being es un excelente primer juego). También lo recomiendo para aquellos que gusten apoyar el trabajo de Felix, un desarrollador independiente. Desde su página se ve que le gusta trabajar conceptos interesantes. Si lo ven en un bundle, no duden que este juego es una buena adquisición (y con buen corazón) para añadir a la biblioteca. También conviene tener un ojo en el desarrollador: cuando consiga un equipo seguramente hará muy buenas cosas.

review:
I got this in a bundle and for the 29 cents US I paid, it was fun.

Think of it as a very simple, single entity (dual personality) version of Trine.  Very much so in that the Thief swinging mechanic and the Wizard telekinesis mechanic are extremely similar.  Death is back to the last checkpoint and there are alot of them so the frustration factor is a little lower, despite some tricky spots.  

It is shorter than Trine and at times a bit more of a grind, but it is a decent and very underplayed game. 

At 4.99 it is hard to justify, perhaps 4.5/10, but in a bundle (and it has been 6 times according to Enhanced Steam), it is an easy 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1447391190}
review:
パズルアクションゲーム。
プラズマ生命体Zebが宇宙を彷徨っていたら宇宙人に捕まったので脱出を目指すのが目的だ。
Zebは最大で4つの形態に変化することができ、ゲーム開始時には2つの形態に変化することが可能だ。1つは特別な能力はない通常の形態、もう1つはテレキネシスが使える形態だ。この2つの他にもゲーム途中で新しい能力の2つの形態を得られ、形態の切り替えでパズルを解いていくことになる。全10ステージでボリュームは多くないもののアクションとパズルの配分が良く、レベルデザインも良く練られているという印象を受けた。

アクションはタイミングがシビアなものが結構あり、特に敵ロボットが偏差撃ちしてくることもありジャンプ中の軌道をずらすなどタイミング良く操作していくことが重要だ。パズルは難易度は高くは無いが、解き方が分かったとしても距離などが合うように試行錯誤して調節していくものが多い。このため、何度か死んで覚えるようなゲーム性となっている。ただし、チェックポイントは多くリスタート操作も可能なために、何度かプレイすればクリアできる難易度だ。見た目は非常に地味だが、ゲーム自体はパズルアクションとして良作だと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561197967559615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1430189640}
review:
Only 2-3 hours of gameplay, the controls are a bit unintuitive, twitchy, and difficult to master, and it's not particularly exciting. In addition, recognition of which objects can be interacted with in which ways is very difficult, leaving an average player quietly perplexed with the lacking game design.

But the mechanics are solid, and a few of the puzzles are quite elegant and satisfying to solve. Imagine starting out on a simple platformer, having the powers of the wizard in Trine. Later you gain the Trine thief's grappling hook, and a limited ability to teleport into certain objects. None of these additional powers are explored to their full potential.

I give it a positive review because it's worth playing around with, if only for the unique feel of the game and its combination of mechanics. However this game has a lot of wasted potential. If the developer were to come out with additional, more complex puzzles, with better level design, and more variety to the environmental mechanics, or open it up to user-created levels somehow, it could be a beautiful thing, a la 2D Portal.

Conclusion: 6/10. A good start, needs more content.
